comments.body: In the integration tests related to RDS I have had to increase timeouts for creation to up to 800.  I had some similar problems working on the auto scaling groups earlier.  I would propose that this timeout should be at the level where the wait is sufficent 95% of the time even at times when AWS is reasonably busy and instance start up takes lots of time.  Do you know if 300 is long enough?
Yeah, for spot instances I'd say 300 is a bit short, unless spotinst behaves *significantly* differently from the AWS spot instance market.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +981,985 @@
    if wait_timeout is None:
        wait_timeout = 300

    wait_timeout = time.time() + wait_timeout
